name: The Montague on The Gardens

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: To celebrate a milestone birthday myself and three friends planned a return visit to the Montague. Having stayed there on two previous occasions we knew what a lovely, welcoming hotel it is, and how that contributed to our enjoyment of the trip, and this stay was no exception.
reviews.title: The wonderful Montague

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: The rooms were lovely, very clean, beautifully decorated and well maintained. We had adjacent rooms and they were quiet and comfortable. We all slept well. The staff are the major asset of this hotel, their kindness and helpfulness is sincere, and they are very friendly and approachable. I must mention Wesley one of the Concierges, who was a really pleasant and friendly chap, and we were sorry to be able to say hello again to George who had been so helpful to us on previous visits.
reviews.title: Good location, friendly staff and a great night's sleep!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are lucky enough to have stayed at many 5* establishments worldwide, and from a staff point of view the Montague is on a par with any of them. Thye surprised me with a balloon, and a plate decoratedwith Happy Birthday, it was much appreciated. They arranged theatre tickets, sorted cabs etc etc. All with a sense of humour and a level of friendliness that is so often missing in even the best of hotels. When in London we will never stay anywhere else.
reviews.title: Great location, attentive staff and attention to fine detail makes this hotel stand out!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Montague. Part business, part leisure trip. The hotel is located in a quiet area but is within a 10 minute walk to Tottenham Court Road or Covent Garden (from there 5 minutes to Leicester Square, 10 mins to Piccadilly). Russell Square tube is 5 minutes walk away, Holborm tube is 8 minutes away. Took advantage of a 3 for 2 deal on a suite. Stayed in room 114 which on some of the previous photos looks horrifically over the top but, once we got over the crazy wall furnishings and managed to get the air-con to kick in (it was hotter than the sun in there when we first arrived!), was one of the most comfortable rooms we have ever stayed in. By no means was it the most spacious but the split-level arrangement suited us: VERY comfortable king-size bed, wardrobes to fit decent-sized cases in, television and a drench shower room on the upper level; on the lower level was a fair-sized sitting room with sofa, chairs, desk, coffee table, tv and mini-bar and wc with bath and shower. The room was at the back of the hotel looking out onto a private garden (unfortunately no access to this) but did mean a lovely quiet night's sleep. Also, you can log on using the hotel system or use your own laptop for free wi-fi access with this deal. Just a couple of gripes - breakfast was mediocre at best. We had arranged breakfast for the 3 days when we booked but after the first morning decided it wasn't worth the money (£16.50 each for full English, buffet-style) or rushing to get down before it finished at 10am (in our experience, quite early for a London hotel catering for business and tourists). There are so many cafes within a five minute walk that will serve prepared-to-order food and allow you to watch the world go by. To give the hotel their due, when we checked out I pointed out that we had only taken breakfast once and they obliged by deducting 2 days charges off the bill. There is a little inconsistency with turn-down service and house-keeping. Not every evening were "treats" left at turn-down, tea and coffee supplies were replenished sparingly and towels seemed to disappear without being replaced. These are little gripes that aren't essentials, but for the hotel rating and tariff should be expected as the norm. The management, waiting and house-keeping staff were all great - professional, yet friendly and made our stay very enjoyable.
reviews.title: Unbelieveable upgrade - they couldn't do enough

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: We stayed at The Montague during March and April on three separate occasions. We got a chance to experience 3 different rooms. We used the Hotel as a base and they were happy to store our luggage while we toured on the Continent and UK.
reviews.title: The Montague is my home across the pond!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Recently travelled with my family and stayed at this hotel. The staff was wonderful, helped in everyway needed. The location is close to two different tube stops. The rooms we had were triple rooms. They were small rooms which is to be expected in the city. I would definately stay here again!
reviews.title: Nice hotel, great location, great staff, small rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well situated by the British Museum in a fairly quiet smart street. Although modest in size the lobby, lounges etc. are tastefully furnished. Similarly our room was not very big but typical of city hotels and once again very nicely fitted out with an excellent bathroom. Everywhere was spotless and our room looked out on the rear of the hotel onto a peaceful tree lined garden....wonderfully quiet.. Worth asking for when you book.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel which oozes quality without going over the top.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We could not fault any dealings we had with staff and only the fairly pricey food and drink charges stop us giving absolutely full marks to the hotel.
reviews.title: Good Location, helpful staff, memorable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was an 50th wedding anniversary weekend for my parents and nothing was too much trouble to the staff at the Hotel to make the stay enjoyable for them.
reviews.title: The Montague is lovely but ...........

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Montague is lovely, very central,helpful staff and lovely rooms but beware how you book. If you book through websites you may, like us, discover when leaving the hotel that you have an extra 17.50% added to your bill. We were unaware that the room rate quoted on the website did not include VAT so when leaving we were charged £129 more than we expected.
reviews.title: Wonderful Weekend Break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Montague on the first two nights of our honeymoon at the end of July. We arrived late, around 9pm, due to connecting flights and had booked a deluxe king as we had spent a lot of time researching on the internet to find something a little special for the start of our honeymoon. When we arrived we were shown to our room which was nothing like what had been described on their website. It was perhaps the smallest room I have ever stayed in, in London, and I have stayed in a number of 4 and 5 star hotels within the same area. The room did not have a separate sitting area as descibred on their webiste and there was barely enough room to put the cases down and be able to get out of the door! We therefore asked whether we had in fact been given the room grade that we booked and were told that this room was indeed a deluxe king, in which case, I can only presume that the rooms below this grade are only just big enough for one person. After some discussion, it did transpire that we had been given a king room not a deluxe king and there were no other rooms available for us to move to because we had arrived so late. I found this a little dissapointing considering that when we filled in the reservation form we had informed them of our time of arrival and that it was our honeymmoon.
reviews.title: On the whole, a good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: That said, and for whatever reason this happened, the staff did seem to go out of their way to make amends and I cannot criticise the service and the attentiveness of the staff. They moved us into another room that next day (although the difference between the rooms was minimal) and they offered us quite a few complimentary drinks and added extra little speical honeymoon touches to our room.
reviews.title: Great Hotel with lovely staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Despite the room mix up, I would still recommend this hotel, primarily because the staff really are as good as everyone else has said here. I doubt that we would have received this level of service in other London hotels and in the end, they did make the start to our honeymoon special.
reviews.title: Lovely but not perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We managed to get a good deal through Voyage Prive and spent 2 nights here. Check-in was quick and all the staff were friendly. They also called the rooms shortly after to check if we were happy with the room. We thought that was a nice touch as we have never had that at any other hotel.
reviews.title: So warm and friendly,its like coming home :o)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had 2 Bloomsbury King rooms which were nicely decorated. The only minor complaint regarding one of the room is that the the bathrom sink was cracked. There was also a strange smell when you walked passed the toilets to get to the rooms. ( I didn't mention this to the staff though).
reviews.title: Great Service and very friendly!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I chose the Montague for a 3-night stay in April as part of a round-the-world trip that included a number of hotels chosen in large part as a result of consulting reviews on TA, as well as viewing the hotels' own websites. Of all the hotels chosen, the Montague was the only one that didn't fully live up to expectation. However, there is nothing really wrong with the place: the service was top-notch, and the location is very convenient. The public areas are attractively and elaborately decorated - no "hip minimalism" here! We walked everywhere (except to/from the airport), with the West End, Covent Garden, and the Holborn area all being easy walking distance. Rather, we felt slightly let down by the room we were given, which, despite being a Bloomsbury Deluxe King, which is supposed to offer more space, was surprisingly cramped. The fact is that our room (#203) was large for London (in this price range I have yet to find a spacious room in inner London), but a lot of the space in our room was occupied by an internal stair-case (cute on first viewing - bit of a nuisance thereafter), and a day-bed which we had to use as a place to put our second suitcase since there was nowhere else to put it. As an example of the tight nature of the room, we struggled to remove the hot-water jug from its shelf under one of the bedside tables: the tray with the jug, cups, etc. seemed to have been placed there via the 4th dimension. There was only a single, small-ish wardrobe for clothes storage, with no drawers. The bed was comfortable, the bathroom was well-appointed and strangely spacious, and the view of the private courtyard garden behind the hotel welcome. There was free internet connectivity, and an in-room safe shoe-horned into the wardrobe. As we know London quite well, we didn't need to ask anything of the staff, but our brief encounters suggested that service wouldn't be an issue. Breakfast was OK, without knocking our socks off ... Perfectly adequate, but for this class of hotel, it would have been nice to see a little more imagination and variety in the offerings. There is an on-site gym, but it is secreted in the basement, at one end of the hotel, and is pretty small. I would consider staying here again, but I suspect the search will continue for our perfect London hotel. (I should add that I did raise the issue of the room size via e-mail with hotel management after our stay and they responded promptly and explained that there are a variety of rooms with varying configurations in each class. Caveat emptor.)
reviews.title: Pleasant well-located hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: From the moment I arrived at the Montague, I was charmed. As a solo traveler, I felt like I was home in this quiet yet very busy boutique hotel. Rooms were fun, sophisticated, well appointed with complimentary bottled water, fruit, and nice toiletries. Lovely linens, very comfy bed, complimentary newspaper, and tea services in the rooms. The staff was attentive, helpful, remembered my name, my likes and dislikes, and would anticipate any requests I had. Yet they were never intrusive, which I appreciated. One evening I was sore from walking, and asked for a hot water bottle before heading to the bar for a drink and to listen to the charming piano player. An hour later I asked if they had found one, and was told it was in my room already filled with hot water and waiting. My feet were thrilled!
reviews.title: Relax in Beautiful, Peaceful Attentive Boutique Hotel in Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is ideal for the British Museum and is a reasonable walking distance to theaters and the Royal Opera House as well as various tube lines. I have stayed in the Double and the Deluxe King on separate stays and found them both exactly as described and would book either again. I loved this hotel and will be returning. Be sure to make a reservation and enjoy their afternoon tea. It is lovely and relaxed. Perfectly adequate pre- theater meal. Breakfast well done and bountiful. Can get a little too busy, and had to wait for a table one morning. That is my only complaint.
reviews.title: Tremondous graditude to The Montague

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from London. Our stay was unexpectedly extended because of the volcano. The staff at The Montague could not have been more accomodating and helpful during our stay. They extended us as long as necessary, honoring our rate and waiving any cancellation fee that would otherwise apply . The concierge could not have been more helpful. We heard some horror stories from other hotels. We felt so fortunate to have been staying at the Montague.
reviews.title: Charming Hotel in a Quiet Neighborhood

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had we not been caught in the volcano's path, I would be commenting anyway, on our lovely room and the wonderful service. We were in the Bloombury King deluxe and it was perfect. It is on a charming, quiet street and very centrally located. If I am in London again, I will definitely stay there.
reviews.title: A perfect Gem- can't wait to go back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found our stay very pleasant. It was extended due to the volcanic ash situation. The staff accommodated us beautifully for the extra four days, allowing us to stay in our room.
reviews.title: The Montague surpassed our expectations.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel is lovely. We ate most meals out, but the one dinner we had at the Blue Door Bistro was excellent.
reviews.title: Enjoyed it but it's not perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: Our room was spotless. The staff was pleasant, courteous and helpful.
reviews.title: A Nice Hotel on Russell Square

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: The location is fantastic. It is literally around the block from the British Museum, near many restaurants, and close to two tube stations. Montague St. is very quiet.
reviews.title: Bumpy start but it got better as each day passed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were very happy with our stay. While we don't anticipate returning to London in the near future, we would stay there again and recommend the Montague to anyone looking for a boutique hotel in a great location.
reviews.title: An Oasis of Calm Sophisticated elegance in the centre of London

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: All previous reviews are very accurate - this hotel is a gem. We had two rooms: a Bloomsbury King for my husband and I and a single for our college-aged son. Both were sumptuously furnished with fabrics and marble baths. At check in we were offered full English breakfast for 10 pounds per person extra, and we felt this was worth it, as the breakfast was very tasty and there were many choices.
reviews.title: Beautiful, Comfortable Hotel with Great Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would disagree with one of the previous reviewers -the online quoted rate does include VAT (at least ours worked out that way).
reviews.title: Stylish elegant hotel in beautiful surroundings and very friendly, attentive staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff is outstanding and very ready to please. Nothing was too much trouble and everything is done with a smile! For example, the wifi stopped working at one point and it was reset 5 minutes after I called to report it, with many apologies included.
reviews.title: perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room faced the street, but there were special double-glazed windows and heavy drapes which blocked out noise quite well. The bed was extremely comfortable, and cleanliness was top-notch all around.
reviews.title: Wonderful Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did have one incident which concerned us. Upon asking about transportation to Heathrow, it was suggested that we take a private car company, which was fine. However, the quoted rate was 75 pounds and was added to our bill. Fortunately we mentioned this to the guide on a Stonehenge tour we went on, and found out that the actual cost was about half that! So we cancelled the car through the hotel and made the cheaper arrangements.
reviews.title: Charming, elegant hotel in quiet residential location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked executive king room for short break. Were delighted to learn of upgrade to junior suite. Unfortunately this meant instead of light room we had expected, we had a room decorated in more heavy colours and materials. Lovely big bed but not much more space in bedroom then stairs down to bathroom which was large and bright. Small issues included window ledge needing re painting - areas where paint or varnish had peeled, and toilet handle coming behind the lid when that was raised (thus chipping the lid).
reviews.title: helpful and friendly staff, room disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: Pillows were very hard and we had only one large bath sheet (plus a small bath towel), however, both these problems were addressed very promptly on request. Also in the course of our stay, the main control switch stopped working - the duty manager managed to fix this also very promptly. Air conditioning was effective but every so often made a very loud noise as if it was emptying out somewhere for about half a minute - we had to switch it off overnight as each episode made us jump!
reviews.title: Feel Like Royalty

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast and dinner were good. The dining room was a bit of an obstacle course at breakfast as the relatively small rooms meant staff and guests were getting in each others way. Also on the topic of food, both nights there were canopes and a fruit platter in our room - very tasty.
reviews.title: Excellent location and good value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: We would come here again but would specify wanting a lighter decorated room
reviews.title: Every Visit is a Treat
Truly a Guv'nor's "Sweet" Experience!
reviews.text: What a charming hotel with a delightful, friendly & helpful staff! M y colleague and I had to find suitable accommodations for a group of five while attending the Farnborough Air Show in July and searched Tripadvisor to point us in the right direction. What a treasure we stumbled upon. We arrived 3 hours before the official check-in. Upon arrival, some of the rooms were available for immediate check-in while a couple of us had to wait 30 minutes. We enjoyed the few minutes while chatting in the charming sitting area outside the breakfast room where we were offered a lovely cup of tea. Once I was shown to my room, I felt like I had just entered a room fit for a PRINCESS. Ironically, in jest my friends and family refer to me being a Princess. What a dream come true. I got the room that I fell in love with while surfing The Montague's website. My husband and I travel to Europe frequently and know the hotel rooms are typically small -- especially in London. I was mildly surprised to be shown to a cozy room with a queen size bed & two sitting chairs. Perfect! My room was on the main level facing the street (Rm 44). At first i thought it was going to be noisy outside due to the cars, but there wasn't a lot of traffic and the heavy curtains (once drawn) kept out the light and any street/sidewalk noise. A delicious breakfast was served every morning starting at 0700. Fresh fruit, yogurts, cereal, and bakery breads for those wanting a light fare. For those who had a hearty appetite, you could enjoy scrambled eggs, bacons, hashbrowns, sausage and pork-n-beans. The fresh coffee, tea and fresh-squeezed orange juice were divine. The staff greeted you with a warm smile and were very efficient. One evening we decided to go to the bar for an after-dinner drink. The outside space was a little too smokey (I have asthma), so we went outside in a very small courtyard where you can look at the "kitchen herb garden". There was no sitting area, but the young lady from the bar brought out three chairs and a small table from the sunroom area and served us drinks . How thoughtful!! She endeared herself to us from the get-go and during our week stay, we went outside to the quaint sitting area she set up for us. Every person we encountered during our stay was delightful. The only small item that detracted from my stay was the exercise room. I am a gym snob and am blessed to have a fully equipped gym in my home. The hotels exercise room had one treadmill, one exercise bike and one elliptical machine--all in one row. That's it. Some free weights, exercise balls, and a little extra space to perform yoga moves would have been nice as my bedroom was too small to perform any stretching exercises. That aside, I would stay at The Montague in a heart beat. Great location to Russell Square (The tube) an adorable park is just down the street where you can enjoy a picnic lunch or just lie in the grass. Plus, the number of GREAT restaurants just around the corner from the hotel was awesome. I can't wait to return and will definitely stay at The Montague.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed in the hotel for 4 nights and i would certainly stay again. The location is perfect, Russell Square is a very quiet and safe part of the center of london. Tube and bus staions are a 5min walking distance. The decoration of the hoter gives you a very good taste of a traditional english house. The rooms are clean and nicely decorated, the beds are huge and you can sleep fine. Personally i would prefer a smaller bed so as to have more space to move in the room. The breakfast is rich and tasty and the atmosphere very warm.
reviews.title: A very good solution!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff of the hotel is definitely its greatest advantage. The people are real professionals, they understand the needs of the clients and are ready to satisfy them. They are very kind and always willing to help thus making you feel very comfortable.
reviews.title: A home away from home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I definitely recommend it!
reviews.title: cosy charming country house in the middle of london

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Montague for a week over Christmas 2009 and again for 4 nights in late January 2010. We chose the hotel because of the rating on Trip Advisor and were not disappointed. The cost was very reasonable for central London. Our rooms were lovely (though small) and the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The location was great. We caught the tube from Heathrow and walked 5 minutes from Russell Square Station whch was so convenient. Breakfast was a highlight. Free internet access was great. Loved the mulled wine over Christmas and the high tea we enjoyed on our return visit. Would highly recommend this place.
reviews.title: Very good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: staff very friendly and extremely helpful bedrooms comfortable everything that you needed it was great to come back to after a busy day and relax in the bar with a drink and good bar food certain we hope to visit again
reviews.title: Great stay & Fab staff
